name: CalABLE
description: California's 529A ABLE savings account program to help people with qualifying disabilities build financial security without risking public benefits.
fullDescription: CalABLE is California's tax-advantaged savings program for people with disabilities, allowing them to save money without affecting eligibility for public benefits like SSI and Medi-Cal.
whatTheyOffer:
- Tax-advantaged savings account (529A ABLE account)
- Save up to $18,000 per year (2024 limit)
- Account balances up to $100,000 don't affect SSI eligibility
- Funds can be used for qualified disability expenses
- Multiple investment options available
- No California state income tax on earnings
howToGetIt:
1. Must have qualifying disability that began before age 26
2. Visit calable.ca.gov to open an account
3. Complete online enrollment
4. Choose investment options
5. Start saving with as little as $25
6. Manage account online
keywords: CalABLE, ABLE account, 529A, disability savings, SSI, Medi-Cal, tax-advantaged, special needs, disability expenses, investment
